channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Prosecution and defense present closing arguments in trial of Sean Combs
item.description: NPR's Anastasia Tsioulcas discusses the closing arguments in the sex trafficking and racketeering trial of hip hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs.

item.title: What this term says about where the Supreme Court is headed
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Bloomberg News Supreme Court reporter Greg Stohr about what we've learned about the makeup and direction of the court from this term's rulings.

item.title: Funeral of Minnesota House Speaker Melissa Hortman and her husband Mark
item.description: Former Minnesota Speaker of the House Melissa Hortman and her husband Mark are memorialized in a funeral in Minneapolis. They were assassinated in their home June 14 in an attack that shocked the nation.

item.title: New Springsteen box set offers unheard treasures for fans
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Caryn Rose about the surprises and treasures in the new Bruce Springsteen box set release this week.

item.title: KPBS's podcast Port of Entry explores the borderlands between Tijuana and San Diego
item.description: KPBS's podcast Port of Entry about the borderlands between Tijuana and San Diego explores the complexities of "life on the line."

item.title: What makes a great movie premise that sticks with you?
item.description: NPR's Andrew Limbong leads a conversation about what constitutes a great premise for a movie - and why a good one sticks with you, even if the film doesn't.

item.title: A compelling new documentary reveals the full life of the iconic astronaut Sally Ride
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Cristina Costantini, director of the new documentary, "Sally," about the life of astronaut Sally Ride.

item.title: Pilgrims and clergy gather in remote Alaska village to canonize first Yup'ik saint
item.description: The Orthodox Christian tradition is strong in the tiny village of Kwethluk, Alaska. It recently welcomed clergy and pilgrims from around the world to canonize a local midwife and healer as a saint.

item.title: People say they've faced withdrawals from SSRIs. They want recognition and research
item.description: A growing number of people who take SSRIs are saying they've suffered difficult withdrawal symptoms from long-term use, including dysphoria and sexual dysfunction.

item.title: This week in science: the power of a nap, planet birth and how wildfires affect water
item.description: NPR's science podcast Short Wave shares how taking a nap can deliver a eureka moment, a new picture of a planet right after it was born, and how wildfires can affect water quality â€“ after the fires stop burning.
